questions.question: The signal is said to be 'stuck at fault' when it is stuck at logic  _____________ .

explanations.c: A 'stuck at fault' means a signal is permanently stuck at a constant logic value, either 0 or 1, regardless of the input conditions.

questions.question: In a multiplexer, the selection of a particular input line is controlled by  _____________ .

answers.d: Both data controller and selected lines

explanations.b: In a multiplexer, the selected line (or select inputs) determines which one of the multiple input lines is routed to the output.

questions.question: Which of the following is a combinational logic circuit designed to switch one of several input lines to a single common out put line?

explanations.c: A multiplexer is a combinational logic circuit that selects one of several input lines and forwards it to a single output line based on select inputs.

questions.question: Which of the following statement is correct?

answers.a: A 4*1 multiplexer has 4 input lines and 1 output line.
answers.b: A 4*1 multiplexer has 4 output lines, 2selection lines and 1 input line.
answers.c: A 4*1 multiplexer has 4 selection lines, 1 output line and 1 input line.
answers.d: A 4*1 multiplexer has 4 output lines, 1 selection line and 4 input lines.

explanations.a: The notation '4*1' in a multiplexer means it selects 1 output from 4 input lines, using selection lines to choose which input to pass through.

questions.question: A combinational circuit that selects one from many inputs is _____________ .

explanations.d: A multiplexer is a combinational circuit that selects one input from many and forwards it to the output based on select lines.
